casebody.data:
UNITED STATES of America, Appellee, v. Antonio JOHNSON, Appellee. No. 03-3363. United States Court of Appeals, Eighth Circuit. Submitted April 22, 2004. Decided May 10, 2004. Edward J. Rogers, Asst. U. S. Attorney, U.S. Attorney’s Office, St. Louis, MO, for Plaintiff-Appellee. *57Antonio Johnson, Beaumont, TX, pro se.

Before MELLOY, HANSEN, and COLLOTON, Circuit Judges.

PER CURIAM.

Antonio Johnson appeals the district court’s1 denial of his 18 U.S.C. § 3582(c)(2) sentence-reduction motion. Having carefully reviewed the record, we agree with the district court that Johnson is not entitled to a sentence reduction based on Amendment 518 to the Sentencing Guidelines. See U.S.S.G. § 1B1.10(a); Delgado v. United States, 162 F.3d 981, 983 (8th Cir.1998).

Accordingly, we affirm. See 8th Cir. R. 47B.

. The Honorable Donald J. Stohr, United States District Judge for the Eastern District of Missouri.
